primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reveals Himself and awakens faith through His own performative Word (the message), bypassing human seeking or spiritual capacity.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have been found by those who did not seek me
I have shown myself to those who did not ask for me
the message itself, unleashed, was racing around... on its own power
faith is awakened by the message

zender.identificatie: God (as the source of the Evangel)
tekstueel_bewijs: the message that awakens it comes through the word of Christ

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (specifically those not seeking)
tekstueel_bewijs: those who did not seek me
those who did not ask for me
How are they to believe... without a preacher?
faith comes from what is heard
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject acting through the Word.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (The Word as a power outside the self).

tekstueel_bewijs: mere disbelief or by any other human obstacle
worry about not having a sufficient amount of faith
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the human attempt to replace God's agency with 'spiritual journeys' or 'inner dispositions,' which Rutledge views as a total eclipse of the Gospel.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preacher's mandate to deliver the message entrusted to them.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher (Seminarians)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The Message (delivered to the ends of the earth)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher's action is a participation in the primary program; they are the 'feet' of the message that God is already 'racing' around the world.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → The Word of Christ → Those who did not seek
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Preacher → The Word/God ← Human Moralism/Spiritualism

voorbeelden_god_subject: God says: I have been found
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we like to read about heroic survival
the speaker... had been raised Roman Catholic
clergy... give every impression of not believing in God

voorbeelden: It is that news... which is now being entrusted to you.
those who did not seek me
those who did not ask for me
Everything depends on... how it is understood
the power that removes human 'spiritual' capacity to the margins
faith which could not be stopped

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of the Word itself. It explicitly deconstructs 'Devoir' (moral obligation) and 'Vouloir' (human seeking) as the basis for faith.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (the 'Tibetan' model of human doing) to ~S2 (the realization that we don't seek) to S1 (the Word finding us).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Faith is not a human work (~S2) but a creation of the Word (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 is identified as the 'dull thud' of modern preaching.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a meta-critique of moralism. It explicitly demands that God be the subject of the sentence and defines grace as God's performative action that precedes human response.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the story celebrated Noah’s capacity to overcome

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The story isn’t about Noah! It’s about God!
I have been found by those who did not seek me

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly attacks exemplarism (the Noah example).
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Noah's story is about God's judgment and preservation, not Noah's strength.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'producing' faith; shift from self-examination to Christ-proclamation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrated; the rhetorical form (the sermon) matches the theological content (the power of the Word).
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'human activity' of preaching and the 'divine power' of the message.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the evangel, understood as victorious power... racing around... on its own power

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Word bestows the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to believe where none existed.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a total incapacity to seek God, requiring God to 'show Himself' to the unasking.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the sole Subject of the primary narrative program (Salvation/Revelation).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a corrective sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (moralism/self-help) is clearly identified and defeated.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God finds us) → Ethics (We preach the news).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, providing a structural antidote to the 'anthropocentric' drift in contemporary homiletics.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on her anecdotes, Greimas' model shows these anecdotes are actantial 'Opponents' to the Gospel.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'akoē' to show how that word functions as the 'Subject' of the narrative engine.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'dull thud' of the Tibetan lecture is a structural failure where the Subject (Man) lacks the Object (God) because the Sender is missing.

appendices.notities: Sermon preached by Fleming Rutledge; embodies her 'Grammar of Grace' theory.
